Description: Twenty-six fragments, including this one, largely joining, of a North Ionian pottery bowl. Inside poorly fired. One handle root and the turn to the foot preserved. Creamy slip on outside. Interior glazed with red bands lined in white; tondo reserved with one bud part-preserved. Pendant lotus-palmette under handle, flanked by expansive volute and leaf pattern. At rim short tongues above stag between lions on one side, part of a lion preserved on the other; below: stopt maeander; lotus and bud frieze, doubly linked; stopt maeander; rays; band above foot Between the friezes red band lined in white.
Curator's comments: Joined to 1888,0601.540 d, f and p,as well as many more whose identity has worn off.
Reconstructed with 1888,0601.540 b, f-g, p-r & t according to register.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.243, no.7)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.449)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 985, pl. 120)
